doc_class_description: A Court of Appeal judgment is a higher court ruling that reviews decisions of lower courts, shaping legal precedent and protecting citizens’ rights.

latest_doc_d.description: Kaluthandrige Ruwan Ajith alias Aja Vs Hon. Attorney General, before Hon. Amal Ranaraja, J.
latest_doc_d.parties: Kaluthandrige Ruwan Ajith alias Aja Vs Hon. Attorney General,
latest_doc_d.keywords: Marking the contradictory nature of witness testimony – Discrepancies in testimonies not pertaining directly to the incident involving the offence itself – Prosecution’s latitude to call witnesses – Adequacy of witnesses in establishing a fact
latest_doc_d.legistation: Section 296 of the Penal Code, Section 134 and 145 of the Evidence Ordinance No.15 of 1895
